 Keep Researching 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 COVID-19 Guidance for Researchers and Research Administrators 
 Agencies and entities are issuing guidance on Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19). Guidance, announcements, and funding opportunities received by Research and Economic Development (RED) are posted here. This page will be updated as new information is available. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Research Announcements 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 18 Jul 
 
 Fast Grants Submissions have Reopened 
 
 
            Thanks to the generosity of a number of donors, including the Audacious Project, we are now soliciting applications for our second round of funding. We expect to make at least $20 million of grants. For the second round of Fast...     
 Read More » 
 More about the Article: Fast Grants Submissions have Reopened
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10 Jun 
 
 Winning COVID-19-related grants 
 
 
            Learn about the SBIR/STTR Program & COVID-19 Funding Presented by the University of California Riverside’s SBIR/STTR Resource Center Friday, June 12, 2020 ● 10:00 a.m. to 11:00 PST CLICK HERE to Register The federal SBIR/STTR program is the leading resource...     
 Read More » 
 More about the Article: Winning COVID-19-related grants
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13 May 
 
 People’s Republic of China (PRC) Targeting of COVID-19 Research Organizations  
 
 
            The FBI is investigating the targeting and compromise of U.S. organizations conducting COVID-19-related research by PRC-affiliated cyber actors and non-traditional collectors.     
 Read More » 
 More about the Article: People’s Republic of China (PRC) Targeting of COVID-19 Research Organizations 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16 Apr 
 
 FY2020 DoD Pre-Announcements 
 
 
            Subject: JUST RELEASED! FY20 DoD Pre-Announcements This e-mail is to notify the research community of recently released Fiscal Year 2020 (FY20) pre-announcements for the Department of Defense (DoD) programs managed by the office of Congressionally Directed Medical Research Programs (CDMRP)...     
 Read More »
